introduction: Tomatoes are a popular home garden plant, offering delicious fruits. They require sun, water, and support.

sections.title: 1. Planting
sections.content: Start seeds indoors 6-8 weeks before the last frost, or buy seedlings. Transplant to larger pots or garden beds when they have a few true leaves. Space plants 2-3 feet apart.

sections.title: 2. Sunlight & Location
sections.content: Tomatoes need at least 6-8 hours of direct sunlight per day. Choose a sunny, well-drained spot.

sections.title: 3. Watering
sections.content: Water deeply and regularly, especially during dry periods. Aim for consistent soil moisture. Avoid wetting the leaves to prevent fungal diseases.

sections.title: 4. Soil & Fertilizing
sections.content: Use rich, well-draining soil with plenty of organic matter. Fertilize every 2-3 weeks with a balanced fertilizer or one formulated for tomatoes once fruit sets.

sections.title: 5. Support & Pruning
sections.content: Most tomato varieties need support like stakes, cages, or trellises. Pruning suckers (shoots between the main stem and branches) can improve air circulation and fruit size for indeterminate varieties.

sections.title: 6. Harvesting
sections.content: Harvest when fruits are fully colored and slightly soft to the touch. Regular harvesting encourages more fruit production.
